Canopy Modelling

Source: R/02_canopy.R
canopy_HTP.Rd

This function performs canopy modelling based on time series data from high-throughput phenotyping (HTP). It optimizes parameters to fit a specified function to the canopy data over time, potentially correcting maximum values and adding a zero point to the series.

Usage

canopy_HTP(x, index = "Canopy", id = NULL, ...)

Arguments

x

An object of class read_HTP, containing the results of the read_HTP() function.

index

A string specifying the canopy trait to be modeled. Default is "Canopy".

id

An optional vector of plot IDs to filter the data. Default is NULL, meaning all plots are used.

...

Additional arguments passed to the modeler_HTP() function.

Value

An object of class modeler_HTP, which is a list containing the following elements:

param

A data frame containing the optimized parameters and related information.

dt

A data frame with data used and fitted values.

fn

The call used to calculate the AUC.

metrics

Metrics and summary of the models.

max_time

Maximum time value used for calculating the AUC.

execution

Execution time.

response

Response variable.

.keep

Metadata to keep across.

fun

Function being optimized

fit

List with the fitted models.

Examples

library(exploreHTP)
data(dt_potato)
results <- dt_potato |>
  read_HTP(
    x = DAP,
    y = c(Canopy, PH),
    id = Plot,
    .keep = c(Gen, Row, Range)
  )
mod <- canopy_HTP(x = results, index = "Canopy", id = c(22, 40))
#> Loading required package: foreach
#> Loading required package: future
plot(mod, c(22, 40))

print(mod)
#> 
#> Call:
#> Canopy ~ fn_piwise(x, t1, t2, k) 
#> 
#> Sum of Squares Error:
#>     Min.  1st Qu.   Median     Mean  3rd Qu.     Max. 
#> 0.001477 0.075360 0.149243 0.149243 0.223126 0.297009 
#> 
#> Optimization Results `head()`:
#>  uid   t1   t2     sse     k  auc   dt slope
#>   22 39.5 74.6 0.29701  98.8 5034 35.1  2.81
#>   40 34.8 60.8 0.00148 100.0 6017 26.0  3.84
#> 
#> Metrics:
#>  Ids      Timing Convergence Iterations
#>    2 0.8199 secs        100%   286 (id)
#>
